text.tspan: So here the values are more like map key/value tuples,
that is, a struct with the 'point' field as well as a
reference to the value (because we might store
'expensive' values, and don't want to rewrite them
when there is a relabeling?) ; also we don't want to
deserialize the values while traversing the octree.
can't we equip the skiplist with efficient append
It all boils down to the octree requiring stable coordinates.
--> the relabeling is totally irrelevant to the octree
; thus we need to store a ref to the entry. thus to
avoid having to _update_ the ref (set the ref) when
relabeling, it is crucial the the TotalOrder _gives us_
already the ref to the entry. (thus we have a "shared ref")
the point is redundant, but we may avoid looking up two or three refs!
The leaf-value '<ref>' versus '(no payload)' could mean that the payload
is just an abstract type parameter A, unless we want to duplicate the total-order
order-entry <opaque> (it will be just the jv-ref / (de)serialize its internal ref)
the skiplist needs a transactional ordering for
